column2: INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS MACHINES CORPORATION Armonk New York 10504
column3: The company estimates that there are 17, 000 scientists, engineers, programmers and support personnel engaged in its various R&D efforts. -IBM Research P.O. Box 218 Yorktown Heights, New York 10598 Director of Research: G. L. Tucker Fields of Interest: Advanced information handling and control systems, advanced programming techniques and solid state devices and technologies. In addition to the domestic sub-division described below, this division also maintains research laboratory facilities in Zurich, Switzerland, at Sauner strasse 4, Ruschlikon; and in Tokyo in the Sanno Daiichi Bldg, at 1 Enokizaka - Mochi Akasarka, Minato-Ker. Research Personnel: J.C.R. Licklider, Mgr. Information Systems, Sciences, and Application H. Thomas, Director, Zurich Lab L. R. Bickford, Jr., Director, Tokyo Lab —Thomas J. Watson Research Center 612 West 115th St. New York, N.Y. 10025 Manager: W. J. Eckert Fields of Interest: Theoretical and experimental research in the science of information systems and the engineering, and construction of supporting experimental systems facilities. Included in these studies are the rational design of Adaptive Man-machine Non-arithmetic Information Processing (AMNIP), and the investigation of formal English-like languages (LOGOS). Applied linguistic research is conducted toward the development of an entire machine translation complex. This activity includes linguistic theory and grammar writing, the sophisticated manipulation of linguistic data on machines, and linguistic metatheory and formal linguistic systems. Particular emphasis is on the Russian & Chinese languages. Also conducts investigations of electronic and electro-optical materials (e.g. phonon interactions in crystals). Research Personnel: C. Abraham, Manager, Information Retrieval Research H. H. Goldstine, Director of Mathematical Sciences R. E. Bargmann, Manager, Statistics and Operations Research G. C. Chow, Manager, Economic Models B. J. Flechinger, Manager, Probability & Statistics —San Jose Research Laboratory Monterey & Cottle Road San Jose, California 95114 J. D. Swalen, Manager Fields of Interest: Theoretical and experimental research in the identification and classification of information in printed text, including both reference retrieval systems and information retrieval systems. The former is based on the automatic indexing of technical documents and the development of appropriate search strategies. The information retrieval investigations the automatic detection of logical relationships among natural language sentences. -Advanced Systems Development Division 1000 Westchester Ave. White Plains, New York 10604 Director, Systems R&D: C. R. De Carlo Asst. General Manager: J. M. Norton —ASD Laboratory 2651 Strang Blvd. Yorktown Heights, New York Manager: N. A. Vogel Fields of Interest: Development and testing of SDI (Selective Dissemination of Information) systems, including the establishment and experimental operation of an SDI system for scientific and technical information for NASA. Also conducts research and experimental development in the fielcl of pattern recognition, including efforts to find computer algorithms for designing pattern recognition logis for both sequential and non-sequential patterns. Input tests have included machine and hand printed characters, spoken words, and electroencephalograms. Theoretical and experimental research is conducted on commercial applications of man-machine information systems. Research Personnel: Raymond E. Bonner (Pattern Recognition) -'-Los Gatos Laboratory P.O. Box 66 Los Gatos, California 95031 Manager: R. B. Johnson Fields of Interest: Experimental research in the application of advanced data processing techniques to library operations, including automatic bibliography preparation and information retrieval using 7090 computer. Also conducting research on oral machine control (modified speech recognition) devices capable of real time recognition of words spoken by persons with normal voice characteristics. Research Personnel: J. W. Luke, Director, Systems Rsch. & Dev. Center -Components Division P.O. Box 390 Poughkeepsie, New York 12533 General Manager: A. H. E schenfelder Fields of Interest: Research and development on advanced solid state devices and electronic materials for application in the products and systems of other company divisions. Research Personnel: W. E. Harding, Mgr, Advanced Dev. E. Bloch, Mgr, Product Dev. —Poughkeepsie Laboratory P.O. Box 390 Poughkeepsie, New York 12533 Manager: W. R. Rave —Kingston Laboratory Neighborhood Rd. Kingston, New York 12401 Manager: M. A. Every -Data Systems Division 1000 Westchester Ave. White Plains, New York 10604 Vice President Development: B. O. Evans Fields of Interest: Design, development, fabrication and testing of large scale computer systems. -Federal Systems Division 326 E. Montgomery Avenue Rockville, Maryland 20850 V.P. Development & Mfg. Operation: H.E. Cooley Fields of Interest: Design and development of computers and related equipment for vehicle self-contained inertial guidance systems, especially for the Saturn family of space vehicles. Also conducts operational research assignments in information handling systems, and investigation of radiation 310 OF THE UNITED STATES International Harvester Company resistant dielectrics. Maintains facilities at Cambridge, Mass, and Los Angeles, Calif, and Kingston, N.Y., in addition to the sub divisions described below: —Space Guidance Center Engineering Laboratory Owego, New York 13827 Fields of Interest: Study, research and development of vehicle self contained guidance systems, primarily computers and converters for inertial guidance system for the Saturn family of spacecraft. Also design and test of capsule and ground components used during Gemini orbital rendezvous program and research on standardized space guidance system. Maintains operating facility at Huntsville, Alabama (P.O. Box 1250). Research Personnel: A. E. Cooper, General Manager J. J. Walsh, Mgr. Engineering Laboratory C. H. Grace, Mgr. (Huntsville Facility) F. A. Foss, Engrg. Mgr. (Huntsville) --Washington Systems Center 7230 Wisconsin Ave. Bethesda, Maryland 20014 Fields of Interest: Research and development on computer oriented data processing systems such application as aviation planning and control systems and airborne range and orbit determination systems studies (AROD). Also development of optical communication (Laser) systems for spacecraft and research on automatic classification of documents by statistical analysis of full text of the documents on a computer.
